issues.description: The problem statement contains an internal contradiction about the return type of messageOnMilk(): the Seal class box in the UML and the Seal method listing show messageOnMilk():String (implying a String return), while the Milkable interface in the UML and the textual instruction in Part 2 state messageOnMilk() should return a boolean ("true if milking was successful, false otherwise"). This contradictory specification in the problem statement will confuse students about whether messageOnMilk() should return a boolean or a String.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the specification in the problem statement. Decide whether messageOnMilk() should return a String (a descriptive message) or a boolean (success flag). If the intended behavior is to return a descriptive message (matching the Seal method box), change the Milkable interface declaration and the textual instruction to require a String return and update the explanatory text accordingly. If the intended behavior is a boolean flag, update the Seal/Goat method signatures in the UML and all textual examples to return boolean and adjust example/solution code to reflect that.

issues.description: The solution repository implements Milkable.messageOnMilk() as returning String, and Goat/Seal.messageOnMilk() return descriptive Strings. This conflicts with the textual instructions and UML (in other part of the problem statement) that specify messageOnMilk() should return a boolean. Students following the problem text would expect a boolean return type but the provided solution demonstrates a String return, creating a mismatch between specification and the provided reference implementation.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the reference implementation consistent with the (corrected) problem specification. If the chosen canonical design is String returns for messageOnMilk(), update the problem statement (UML and text) to require String returns. If the canonical design should be boolean, change the solution interfaces and implementations (Milkable, Goat, Seal) so messageOnMilk() returns boolean and adapt the implementations to return true/false as appropriate.
